flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
This video shows the demo of the project in action: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sYOBIhcP2...

Here is the description of how this hack works: http://www.rtfms.com/episode-4-turn-your... One interesting feature is that one can control TV from a web browser, no special software is required.

Currently it supports 5 different brands of TVs and has range of up to 9ft. I keep adding new commands and devices and working on improving the range.

lines.text: All we need is two 940nm IR LEDs ($2.50 for 10 or $5 for 50 on eBay) and an audio plug that fits your smartphone. You can salvage it from broken headphones or buy for $1
lines.text_raw: All we need is two 940nm IR LEDs ($2.50 for 10 or $5 for 50 on eBay) and an audio plug that fits your smartphone. You can salvage it from broken headphones or buy for $1

lines.text: Attach the two LEDs to the plug like it is shown on the picture. Long leg of one LED and short leg of another LED go to the large tab on the plug. The rest of the LED legs go to the rest of the plug connectors.

guide.summary: The purpose of this project is to turn an iPhone into a universal remote. It also works for Android phones, many mp3 players, PCs, /Macs, etc.
guide.title: Turn your iPhone(Android, Mac, PC, Player, etc) into a Universal Remote
